page.title: 12Food in Woodhalls
page.content: The traditional foods of the area have evolved over the centuries in a rural environment which used to be extremely isolated.The women had to provide substantial meals from what was readily available for their hard- working menfolk. Cattle,sheep and pigs provided meat,milk,cream,butter and cheese. Cereals, vegetables, fruit,herbs and flavourings were grown in the fields and hedgerows. Some ingredients such as saffron for saffron cakes is no longer grown but many traditional dishes are still made.Pasties are baked with a wide variety of sweet and savoury fillings. Where dairy cows are kept clotted cream is made, and hogs pudding and other savoury offal dishes are made when a pig is killed. (Recipes p13)
